name: The Mother: The BRAND NEW addictive, pulse-pounding thriller from Valerie Keogh, author of NUMBER ONE BESTSELLER The Nurse for 2024

title: WOW!!! JUST WOW!!!!! READ. THIS. BOOK.
content: WOW!! Totally not what I was expecting right up till the last pages!! This is a great book!! I highly recommend this one!!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 1, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is Keogh's best book yet!! Just really an unexpected twisty turny thriller that has you racing to get to the end!! I've read quite a few books that I would consider books that I couldn't put down & most of those would be from really hugely well known popular very established authors, and well they just need to move over cause Valerie Keogh is here to stay y'all!! Make Room at the Top!!! This lady has it in spades & this book proves she deserves to be included!!! I'm a Valerie Keogh Fan & Proud Of It!!! Amazing, just Amazing!!!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 2, 2024

title: Lots of twists and turns in this story
content: Good read keeps you guessing till the end Will leave you guessing and a lot of moments that you think you have figured it out you would have been wrong.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 10, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is such a good psychological thriller! I literally read it within a 24hr period because of the twists & turns. Sometimes I disliked the main character so much yet I sympathized with her. What's the thin line between love and obsession? Read The Mother to find out. You'll be surprised there may be more than one answer.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024

title: Wow! Twists & turns til the end
content: Good read. Many twist and turns. The ending was not expected. I enjoyed this book. It kept me guessing the entire time.

title: The question of Who is Guilty
content: The Mother is about Sarah, who is unhappily married to Nick. She then reluctantly becomes a mother. That is where the story really takes off. I was pleasantly surprised at all of the twists and turns; never seeing them coming. Kudos to the author for a book that was interesting and surprising throughout.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2024

title: Twisted Tale!
content: This book is a great Whodunnit  mystery. Although I enjoyed the story,I didn't give it a five stars, as I was able to figure out what was going to happen next all throughout the book. Still, I was unable to lay the book down. It was a great story about a lady who was unable to love her husband and baby and the consecquences were great!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 8, 2024

title: Lots of suspense
content: A truly twisted tale! Just when you think you know what is happening, the story takes you in a completely new direction. Very well done!

title: Great book!

title: The mother, the husband, the friend, or...?
content: I had previously read The Mistress and The Mother by this author, so I was ecstatic to get this one! I only hoped I would like it as much as the other two, and it did not disappoint!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2024

title: Surprise!
content: Sarah should be thrilled to be married to her perfect, handsome, kind husband Nick. But she knows she made a mistake and wants out. Nick wants something else – a baby; so Sarah agrees. When the baby arrives and Sarah can’t bond with her, she resents Nick even more. When baby Kaya goes missing, Sarah’s world comes crashing down. Will they find Kaya and save her marriage?
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024

title: Enjoyable read with some well played twists
content: WOW – that about sums up everything that happens in this book. First you think one person is responsible, then another, then another until you are shocked to find out who is responsible for all that happens. I could not wait to keep reading and see what happened and the twists and surprises just kept coming. I will definitely recommend this book to everyone!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2024

title: WOW

title: Page Turner
content: No spoilers because you just have to read it to believe —— the ending coming at you like a rogue hit an run leaving you speechless as you pick up the pieces  Found this one after another one of Valerie Keogh’s books ….. it all started with The  Nurse which was available on Amazon. I think I’m going to bing read everything I can get my hands on by this author. There’s never a dull moment as I stay up way past my bedtime reading late into the night. These are the kind of books that leave you wanting more of the character’s lives and relationships. It’s almost like the end of a serious crush when you have the page for ratings suddenly pop up. I nearly groaned when this one plunged into an ending.  Off to Amazon to another Keogh masterpiece. It’s gonna be a long time before it’s lights out for me ……
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2024

title: Holy twists!!!
content: This is another fast paced thriller from Valerie Keogh. It is impossible to put down! At first I was so aggravated at some of the characters but soon realized  I had most of them pegged wrong. Plenty of twists and turns.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2024

title: Good Storyline
content: Holy Moly!! I’m so glad I had off of work today because I was able to read this in one sitting. There was nothing, not even a bathroom break that stopped me from carrying my kindle around all day today to read this. I recently read and reviewed The Mistress and loved it so I thought I would read another by the author and this one was even twistier. I’m not going to go into the synopsis because you can read that on your own and saying anything at all will take away the pure reading pleasure of this book. My mouth is still on the floor as the twists didn’t stop until the end and then still didn’t stop. Do not miss this one. Valerie Keogh is my new favorite author. A million thank you’s to Netgalley and Boldwood Books for the advanced copy and to Valerie Keogh for giving me the biggest book hangover ever!!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2024

title: terrible book
content: This book was not what I expected.  The main character is very unlikable as is every other character in the book.  The plot has many twist and turns but not in a good way. title: I don't write a lot of book reviews because - *** Major Spoilers****
content: I don't write a lot of book reviews - and certainly not a lot of 1 star book reviews because I understand that for writers & authors, novels and books are like their babies. And just like I wouldn't criticize a baby, it feels wrong to criticize a book.

title: Very Good Read
content: I love a LONG book. I'm a 'fast' reader, even when I try to slow down and savor a good story, I tend to read like I have a pending deadline. In fact, the better the story, the faster I gobble it up. So I truly adore a longer story. I was excited to see that this book was very lengthy compared to many of the prime reads I'd partaken of recently.
